data.title: Royal Ascot 2023 LIVE: Results, race times, day-by-day schedule and how to follow illustrious flat racing event
data.meta_description: Royal Ascot is upon us once again and the historic horse racing event promises to be another thriller.The illustrious event, which dates back to the 1
data.text:
Royal Ascot is upon us once again and the historic horse racing event promises to be another thriller.

The illustrious event, which dates back to the 1700s, is usually attended by members of the Royal Family and will see the best in the business take to the famous racecourse.

Racegoers will flock to Berkshire to see some world-class flat racing take place with five days of incredible action expected.

This will be the first Royal Ascot since the death of Queen Elizabeth II who was regularly seen at the event throughout her reign.

The late Queen will be honoured at the racecourse this year with Platinum Jubilee Stakes being renamed to The Queen Elizabeth II Jubilee Stakes.

GET £60 IN FREE BETS ON ROYAL ASCOT WITH talkSPORT BET

Royal Ascot 2023: Date and start time

Royal Ascot 2023 will take place from Tuesday, June 20 until Saturday, June 24.

Seven races are scheduled for each day with the first set to commence at 2:30pm.

The final races of each day will go off at 6:10pm.

Royal Ascot 2023: How to follow

talkSPORT will have live coverage from Ascot throughout the week.

Rupert Bell and Lizzie Kelly will bring fans commentary of 4 races each day including the marquee race.

To tune in to talkSPORT or talkSPORT 2 through the website, click HERE for the live stream.

You can also listen via the talkSPORT app, on DAB digital radio, through your smart speaker and on 1089 or 1053 AM.

The event will also be broadcast live on ITV 1 each day with coverage starting at 1:30pm.
